intro: Psychotria malaneoides var. vestita, commonly known as the white psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. The plant has been studied for its potential pharmacological properties due to the presence of various alkaloids.
